info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Ouachita River At Monroe affecting Union, Ouachita and Caldwell Parishes.
For the Ouachita River...including Felsenthal Lock and Dam, Monroe, Columbia...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ouachita River at Monroe.
* WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, The Prairon Bayou recreational area floods and closes. Lowland flooding becomes extensive at this stage between levees.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 31.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 40.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Friday morning and continue rising to 45.0 feet Tuesday, April 22. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 44.9 feet on 03/26/1903. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Monday evening at 815 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Caldwell, LA; Ouachita, LA; Union, LA
